sub_title: CEO MetaStory Institute | Foundation for a Systemic Approach to Modern Slavery​ (SVIAM)
summary: Experienced Expert, Consultant and Lecturer on Trafficking in Human Beings & Modern Slavery with a specialism and background in Media as Director and Executive Producer of Documentaries.

profile_positions.description: On all recent projects and update see https://metastory.nl/english/
profile_positions.title: CEO MetaStory Institute | Human Trafficking & Modern Slavery Expert | Documentary Director

company.name: University of Applied Sciences, The Netherlands, Ede

profile_positions.description:
Teaching and developing specialist courses on Human Trafficking at University of Applied Sciences, for Professionals, Post Graduate and BA Minor Students. Including Blended/E-learning and Multimedia. 

Lecturing on: 
Introduction Trafficking in Human Beings
Sexual Exploitation 
Labor Exploitation and organ trafficking
Politics, law, culture and religion
Human trafficking indicators and Barriers Model
Good and bad practices/Multi agency cooperation 
Ethical dilemma’s in care and media 
Human Rights etc etc.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer on Trafficking in Human Beings & Modern Slavery

profile_positions.description:
Leadership role (HICON) on LIVE Training Simulation "Combating Human Trafficking along Migration Routes" where I was participating as Journalist/Media expert last year. 
Four day live-simulation on Trafficking Human Beings on Migration Routes. With with over 80 participants from 30 + different countries learning the best about multi agency-, human rights- and victim-centred approach with professionals: Prosecutors, Lawyers, Police, Labor Experts, NGO and civil society specialists in this field of "Combating Human Trafficking along Migration Routes". 

 I my opinion the best and unique multi-agency and international training in it's kind.
profile_positions.title: Expert Media/Journalism Trafficking in Human Beings on Migration Routes

profile_positions.description: The Salvation Army (TSA) in Europe has implemented the Safe Havens project to strengthen transnational co-operation, with the aim of providing 'safe havens' for (potential) victims of trafficking. Part of the EU-project has been the production of the Safe Havens film. This 80 minutes documentary film takes us on a road trip across Europe to discover what TSA and its partners are doing in the fight against human trafficking. My Role: 1. Producing/directing/filming the educational film in 7 countries on Human Trafficking in Europe (80'), 2. Development and implementation of a sustainable training programme for AHT national contact persons and fieldworkers. For this purpose an educational film has been produced, advanced training has been provided to key officers and staff (with a primary focus on the Romania/Moldova/Ukraine/Georgia/Russia region), and TSA Europe AHT national contact persons have been trained. see: https://www.salvationarmy.org/ihq/ahteurope
profile_positions.title: Project "Safe Havens": Educational Documentary & Training on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery

company.name: International Center for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)

profile_positions.company: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
profile_positions.description: Preventing, Identifying and Combating Trafficking in Persons in Turkey (P-TIP Turkey). Key Expert and Trainer/Developer Component 2 on ‘Awareness Raising of all forms of TIP in Turkey. The expected results include increasing the level of awareness with regards to all forms of trafficking among the targeted population and the general public. The overall purpose of this project is to enhance the capacity of relevant Turkish anti-trafficking stakeholders and in particular, the Directorate General of Migration Management (DGMM), to fight all forms of the crime of trafficking in persons (TIP) according to a four Ps approach: prevention, protection, prosecution and partnership. see: https://www.icmpd.org/our-work/capacity-building/regions/western-balkans-and-turkey/ongoing- projects/
profile_positions.title: Consultancy, Media Expert on Trafficking in Human Beings

profile_positions.company: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
profile_positions.description:
International Centrefor Migration Policy Development (ICMPD) Project: Fight against Trafficking in Human Beings and Organised Crime – Phase 2 (THB/IFS/2). The overall objective of the project was to contribute to the prevention of and fight against transnational organised crime, particularly in relation to trafficking in human beings (THB) in Albania, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), Moldova, Pakistan and Turkey. 

Follow up Media training on THB of Editors and Journalist in Turkey (in Ankara and Istanbul, October 2017) and in Azerbaijan (Pakistani Journalist and Editors) November 2017. see: https://www.icmpd.org/our-work/capacity- building/programmes/anti-trafficking-programme/completed-projects/ and: https://www.icmpd.org/news-centre/news-detail/expert-voice-reporting-on-trafficking-in-human-beings/
profile_positions.title: Consultancy, Training, Media Expert Trafficking in Human Beings

Four day live-simulation on Trafficking Human Beings on Migration Routes. With with over 80 participants from 30 + different countries learning the best about multi agency-,  human rights- and victim centered approach with professionals: Prosecutors, Lawyers, Police, Labor Experts, NGO and civil society specialists in this field of "Combating Human Trafficking along Migration Routes". 

 I my humble opinion the best  and unique multi- agency and international training in it's kind.  Links below.

company.name: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)

profile_positions.company: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
profile_positions.description:
ICMPD Project: Fight against Trafficking in Human Beings and Organised Crime – Phase 2 (THB/IFS/2). The overall objective of the project was to contribute to the prevention of and fight against transnational organised crime, particularly in relation to trafficking in human beings (THB) in Albania, Azerbaijan, Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), Moldova, Pakistan and Turkey. My Role: 1. Keynote speaker and moderator on Conference for Media on Trafficking in Human Beings in Vienna. I was invited by ICMPD to be the keynote speaker and moderator on Media and Trafficking in Human Beings in Vienna. 

How is human trafficking is portrayed in the media; the good and bad practices ? I felt privileged to show members of the press and officials, prosecutors, police and civil society the complexity of this and how journalists can improve the reporting of it. The conference was instigated by ICMPD, the participants came from Azerbaijan, Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Turkey and Moldova.
profile_positions.title: Keynote Speaker and Moderator Trafficking in Human Beings and Media
